Summary: The 3 West Club is noted for its excellent location near Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral, offering clean, decent rooms with flat-panel TVs and digital cable. It may not be suitable for those seeking luxury amenities like room service.

Hotel 414 is a small hotel near Times Square and Restaurant Row, convenient to Penn Station and the subway. It offers amenities such as free WiFi, a computer for guests, and a basic continental breakfast.
60 Thompson offers free wireless internet, but some rooms lack a desk, except for suites. There is no business center; a small computer is available at the front desk.
6 Columbus is conveniently located near the subway and Time Warner Center. Some rooms have desks, but some business travelers have complained about the lack of space.

This hotel is conveniently located near Grand Central Station and provides comfortable rooms with a desk, flat-screen TV, and iPod docking station. They offer free wifi, newspapers, and computers in the lobby, as well as business-related services such as printing boarding passes.
The Ace Hotel provides free Wi-Fi, and is near Penn Station, a subway stop, and bus routes. Some rooms include a work desk and a radio with a laptop plugin.

The Affinia 50 offers business travelers office space in the rooms, ergonomic chairs, laptop connections, and spacious rooms. Free Internet access to airlines' websites and boarding pass printing is available, but wireless internet access is an extra charge.

The Affinia Dumont offers spacious rooms with a large desk and ergonomic chair and is located close to the subway, Grand Central Station, and Penn Station. It is also equipped with a gym, and reviewers report the staff are friendly and helpful.
The Affinia Gardens offers spacious rooms with kitchens, a quiet atmosphere, and a location convenient to major amenities. A desk is available in each room, and high-speed internet can be purchased.

The hotel has a dedicated info area for business travelers during core hours, and some rooms offer an office nook. It has a business center with internet access in the lobby, but there's a fee to use it.

The Affinia Shelburne is conveniently located near corporate Midtown and Grand Central Station, although not directly on subway lines, and offers spacious rooms with a kitchenette suitable for longer stays. It also provides internet access for a fee.

AKA United Nations offers spacious, modern apartments with full kitchens, separate lounge areas, and complimentary broadband internet access, and is conveniently located near the UN Headquarters and Grand Central Terminus. The hotel provides services like a light breakfast on weekdays, a 24-hour gym, and is close to a corner store and supermarket.

The Algonquin Hotel is well-located, near Grand Central Station, has wireless internet, and a business center, though the business center has only one computer and one printer that's poorly maintained. Some found the staff friendly and helpful, and some rooms have a desk.

This budget-friendly inn is in Midtown Manhattan, within walking distance to Times Square, the Empire State Building, and transportation, and offers amenities such as internet access and a safe deposit box. Rooms are small and basic with shared bathrooms that are generally clean, and street-facing rooms may experience noise.

Amsterdam Court Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and subway lines, but rooms are small and may have limited amenities; note that WiFi is available for an additional fee. Some rooms may have limited natural light or street noise.

The Astor on the Park is a budget-friendly hotel near the subway and Central Park, with small, clean rooms and friendly staff. Some guests have noted issues with noise, heating, and limited amenities.

The Hotel Bedford is located near Grand Central Station, providing easy access to transportation, and offers rooms with amenities such as free WiFi, kitchenettes, ironing boards, and trouser presses. Some rooms have a separate living room, workspace and digital safes.
The Beekman Tower offers spacious suites with full kitchens, and a business center, but in-room internet access costs extra. It is located in midtown near the UN.

The Belleclaire Hotel on the Upper West Side has modern rooms with desks, flat-screen TVs, iPod docks, and free Wi-Fi, and is near subway lines making it convenient to reach other business locations. The Manhattan Diner across the street is available for room service.

The Bentley Hotel offers great value and spacious rooms, but it's a bit out of the way, about a 5-block walk to the subway; also, there is no business center and internet access costs extra. Some reviewers noted that it's conveniently located near the Animal Medical Center, making it suitable for those visiting.

This hotel has free WiFi, a business center with 2 computers and a printer, and rooms with a desk and safe large enough for a laptop. It's located near the Financial District and has easy access to subways.
This hotel is conveniently located near the Javits Convention Center. It offers free WiFi, a business center, and is close to public transportation.

The hotel offers free internet in the lounge and workstations, and rooms feature a desk, dining table, and full-sized kitchen which may be useful for business travelers. It's centrally located near the UN, Grand Central Station, and the subway.

The Seaport Inn is located near the Financial District and offers free wireless internet, making it convenient for business travelers. Some rooms have a desk area, and the hotel is quiet, which is suitable for those needing a calm environment.

The Blue Moon Hotel offers amenities such as free in-room WiFi, and some rooms have a desk and comfortable seating; the hotel is located near subway lines for convenient access around the city. Some reviewers mentioned the hotel is quiet, and rooms have climate control.
Broadway Plaza Hotel is a clean and well-maintained hotel that offers amenities such as free Wi-Fi and a business center. It is conveniently located near public transportation.
The Buckingham Hotel offers apartment-style rooms with a kitchen, desk, and CD player. There is free Wi-Fi in the lounge and an extra charge for in-room internet access.

Candlewood Suites Times Square provides free in-room wireless, a full-size refrigerator, a working desk and chairs, and is located a few blocks from the Javitz Centre. However, there is no business center on-site.

The Carlton Arms is a budget-friendly hotel in midtown Manhattan, near a college and several subway stops. It has limited amenities like no TV or phone in the rooms, and internet access is available in the lobby for a fee.
The hotel has new facilities, a fridge, and a safety deposit box. Rooms have a coffee maker, free HBO, a flat-screen TV, and individual temperature controls.
Casablanca Hotel offers free wifi, but reviewers note that the internet can be slow. It also includes access to a computer and printer in the cafe, and is centrally located near subway lines.

Chambers Hotel is a small, high-class boutique hotel located off 5th Avenue, making it convenient for shopping and dining. It provides amenities like in-room high-speed internet, and helpful staff for business needs.

Chelsea Lodge is a budget-friendly hotel with small but clean rooms, shared bathrooms, and free WiFi, located near subway stations and restaurants. It's a quiet, secure location with a police precinct nearby.

Chelsea Pines Inn is a moderately priced inn with wifi, breakfast included, and a business center; it is located a half block from the L train for easy transport uptown. Some rooms have a separate kitchen/seating area.

The Chelsea Savoy is a no-frills hotel with wireless internet access and a convenient location near the metro, good restaurants, and a movie theater. Rooms are small and clean, making it a suitable place to sleep, and the front desk staff is friendly and recognizes returning guests.

The hotel has a good midtown location and offers free wireless internet, which is useful for business travelers. However, some rooms lack a desk and chair, and the lighting may not be suitable for desk work.

Solita Soho offers free internet access and a convenient location near Little Italy, Chinatown, and Soho, making it easy to catch a cab. However, it lacks facilities such as a business center and rooms may be small with potential noise issues from a nightclub.

Club Quarters Downtown is a modern, clean hotel in NYC's Financial District, near Wall Street and subway lines, with amenities like free Wi-Fi, bottled water, a fitness room, and a business center. Rooms are small but functional, catering to business travelers.

Club Quarters Midtown is a business-oriented hotel with small rooms, free WiFi, a comfortable bed, and a good workspace. It has a lounge with free computers and is centrally located near Times Square and Grand Central.

Club Quarters Rockefeller Center is designed for business or solo travelers, with small but efficient rooms featuring a workspace, complimentary internet, and easy access to midtown locations. The hotel offers convenient business services and a 7th-floor lounge/restaurant, though some rooms may experience street noise.
The Comfort Inn Chelsea offers free wifi, hardwire internet cords, and a business center, but the computer and printer have a minimum charge of $3. Rooms have a desk and safe.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan is conveniently located near Penn Station and offers free internet access in the lobby. Some rooms include a safe and are equipped with a desk, while the hotel's location is convenient to subway stations.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge offers free WiFi, computers with free internet access in the lobby, and is located near multiple subway stops for easy access around the city. Some rooms have a desk with an office-type swivel chair.

The Comfort Inn Midtown is centrally located near Times Square and offers free wireless internet, a business center with computers and printers, and a fitness center. Some rooms include a desk and free local and long-distance calls within the US.

The hotel offers free high-speed Wi-Fi in rooms and the lobby, and a computer with a printer is available for guests to use. Some rooms include a desk and multiple electrical sockets, and the hotel provides a free continental breakfast.

The hotel offers free high-speed internet, a free continental breakfast, and is located within walking distance of Penn Station. Some rooms have a coffee maker, and the hotel is close to the Javits Center.

This hotel offers free Wi-Fi, a work desk in every room and is conveniently located near the Port Authority bus and subway stations. It's also within walking distance of Times Square, making it easy to access various business locations.
The hotel offers free Wi-Fi, and some rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows with city views. It is located close to subway lines and provides access to a fitness center.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is a basic, clean hotel in Tribeca with free Wi-Fi, and is conveniently located near subway lines for easy access to lower Manhattan attractions, with many coffee options nearby. It is suitable for business meetings in 7 WTC and perfect for low-key leisure travel.

This hotel is a standard business hotel with a great location, opposite a subway station and within walking distance of Midtown sights. There is free coffee, a business center, and free internet in the lobby, with some rooms having a desk.

The hotel offers wired internet in rooms, a business center in the lobby with free internet and printing, and is close to a local hospital with preferred rates. Some found the location decent for business, although a bit far from the subway.

This Courtyard Marriott is in Midtown, close to public transportation and Grand Central station, and offers free internet and a business center. Some rooms have a desk, and there is a restaurant and deli, though some found the service slow.

This hotel has a business center with free internet and printing, and free Wi-Fi is available, but it may not work well in the guest rooms. Some rooms have a spacious layout with a king-size bed plus a sofa bed, with a work desk.

The Crosby Street Hotel is located in the heart of SoHo, close to subway, bus lines, and Broadway. It offers amenities such as a gym with up-to-date equipment, concierge service for car service and reservations, and spacious rooms, with suites available.
This hotel is located near Times Square, offers amenities such as wireless internet, a business center, and rooms with work desks. It is close to public transportation for travel to meetings.
The Da Vinci Hotel offers free internet access in the lobby and is located close to subway lines. Some rooms have a desk, and there is a restaurant and bar on site.

The Doubletree Guest Suites offers a centrally located suite hotel with large rooms, a well-equipped business center, and work space. It has wireless internet, though some reviewers note connectivity issues in certain rooms.

The Doubletree Chelsea is a newer hotel conveniently located near Penn Station, offering modern amenities such as a business center and comfortable beds; however, it suffers from slow elevators and small rooms, which may be problematic for business travelers needing quick and efficient service. Internet access is also not complimentary, which is unusual.

The Doubletree Metropolitan is conveniently located near major bank headquarters and the 51st St subway, making it ideal for business travelers. The rooms are comfortable, tidy, spacious, and well-illuminated, and the staff is kind, efficient, and helpful.
The hotel has wired internet access in rooms, but no business center or area to print boarding passes. The desk is placed very high, making it hard to work on with a laptop.

The Duane Street Hotel is located in the Tribeca area, close to subway lines for easy access to other parts of the city. The hotel offers amenities such as free WiFi, laptop-sized safes, and access to a nearby gym.

The Dylan Hotel is conveniently located near Grand Central Terminal, making it ideal for business travelers needing easy access to transportation. The hotel offers amenities such as a business center, wireless internet, and comfortable rooms suitable for work.

The Eastgate Tower is conveniently located near Midtown and Grand Central Terminal and offers oversized suites, wireless internet, and a fitness center. Some rooms have a separate sitting area and a desk.
This hotel offers free Wi-Fi, complimentary breakfast, and a business center, but rooms are very small. The location is central to Times Square, and within walking distance of the Port Authority.

This hotel is a generic, mid-range business hotel with large rooms, a business center, and a good gym (New York Sports Club). Some rooms have a view of the Hudson River, and it is located near the World Financial Center.

The Empire Hotel offers amenities for business travelers such as free Wi-Fi, a business center, and desks in some rooms. However, some rooms can be noisy and have small bathrooms, and some past guests reported issues with in-room internet access.

Envoy Club offers spacious studio and apartment-style rooms with fully equipped kitchens, decent work areas, and private phone/fax lines, but front desk hours are limited. Wireless internet is available, though service can be unreliable, and the location is near the NYU Medical Center.

The hotel is located in the Financial District near Wall Street and offers large rooms with a fridge and microwave. Some rooms have futon-style beds, and the hotel has a business center, but no exercise facility and spotty wireless service.
The Excelsior Hotel has free wireless internet, and rooms have work desks. It is located in the Upper West Side close to a subway station for easy transport.
The Fairfield Inn offers free internet, a business center, and is conveniently located near the subway, making it easy to get around. However, it lacks meeting rooms and has limited space.

Fitzpatrick Grand Central is in an excellent location for business as it is within walking distance of midtown and accessible to subways and trains to Westchester and Connecticut, plus rooms include amenities such as an iron, hairdryer, a desk, and WiFi access for a fee. Some rooms are large, it has a pub downstairs that attracts a fun crowd, and room service is available.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is a decent business option with large suites, a separate living area, and a tiny kitchenette that includes a fridge and coffee maker. It also provides free access to a mid-range sports club down the street.

Flatotel is in a great midtown location, within walking distance to the east side, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and Central Park, with subway access at 50th & Broadway or 6th & 57th. The hotel offers a free business center and WiFi.
The hotel has comfortable beds and free internet. There is also a work desk with an ergonomic chair, along with multiple power outlets.

The Four Points SoHo is a modern hotel with small, functional rooms that include a work desk, free WiFi, and wired internet. It's located near subway lines, making it convenient for business travel around the city.

The hotel offers free wired and wireless internet, a business center with a printer, and rooms with a work area and plenty of outlets. Some rooms have an iPod docking station and a desk designed for laptop use with built-in USB connections.

The hotel caters mostly to corporate people, and is conveniently located near Lexington Avenue subway stations. Rooms have a large oval table which serves as a working desk, with internet connection, a printer/fax/scanner, and electrical devices.

Gild Hall is a conveniently located hotel in Manhattan's Financial District, with subway access, and offers amenities such as internet (for a fee), mini-bar, and toiletries. Some reviewers mention the availability of a business center and a mini-gym.

The hotel offers free internet/wireless in the room, but power outlets are few and inconvenient, with only one at the desk and two in the bathroom; the business center is literally a small closet off the front desk with room for only one person at a time at a tiny desk. The rooms also have comfortable beds and quiet environments.

The Grand Hyatt is located in midtown Manhattan, connected to Grand Central Station, and provides easy access to the subway. It tries hard but is rather soul less and clearly designed for business travel, furnishings were above average and public areas seemed clean and well-maintained.
The Greenwich Hotel offers free WiFi, though some reviewers found it slow. Some reviewers mentioned business meetings taking place in the lounge.

The Hampton Inn is centrally located near Penn Station, Times Square, and the subway, and offers free WiFi, a business center, and a fitness room. Some rooms include a desk, and the hotel provides complimentary breakfast and 24/7 beverage service.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden provides free wireless internet in the rooms, free computers in the lobby, and a business center for travelers. The location is convenient to Penn Station, subways, and various business locations.
The Hampton Inn Chelsea offers free high-speed internet, a business center, and a complimentary breakfast. It's conveniently located near transportation and mellow bars.
Hampton Inn Soho provides free internet, a business center with computers, and is near public transport. Some reviewers mentioned that the hotel attracts a certain clientele, and can be noisy.

The hotel offers a business center with computer terminals and printers with high-speed internet, and free internet access in the rooms. It's conveniently located near Times Square and provides a free breakfast and menus from local restaurants that deliver.

The Hampton Inn Seaport/Financial District is conveniently located near Wall Street and the US Federal Courts, with free internet, a good desk, and included breakfast. It is also close to subway and bus stops for easy access to midtown.

The Helmsley Middletowne offers large rooms with ample closet space, a refrigerator, and a safe, and provides a newspaper on weekdays; however, there's no desk in the suite rooms and internet is provided through an antiquated modem. The hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station and the Lexington subway line.
The Hilton Club offers a business center, wireless access, and is located near a train station and taxis. Some suites are spacious enough to accommodate up to 6 adults.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is a modern, clean hotel with free Wi-Fi, wired internet, printer access, and a business center, and is conveniently located near Penn Station. Rooms include a desk, flat-screen TV, microwave, and refrigerator.

This Hilton Garden Inn is strategically located in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, making it a perfect location for business purposes. The hotel has free Wifi, a free business center, and Herman Miller office chairs.

The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square offers free wireless internet, a free business center with printing, and ergonomic chairs, making it suitable for business travelers. Select rooms also include a microwave, refrigerator, and large desk.

The Hilton Garden Inn Tribeca offers free Wi-Fi, a business center with free computer and printer access, and rooms with a desk, microwave, coffee maker, and refrigerator. It's located near subway lines for easy access to other parts of the city.

The Hilton New York is a large hotel with conference facilities and business center, though internet access is an added fee. Some reviewers mention comfortable rooms with desks and ergonomic workstations.

The Hilton Times Square is noted as a good business hotel, with amenities for business travelers such as a writing desk and writing chairs in some rooms. Select rooms offer writing desks, and the hotel's location is convenient to public transportation.

This hotel offers free Wi-Fi, a business center with computers and a printer, and is conveniently located near Grand Central Station. The hotel is clean and functional, designed for travelers who won't spend much time inside.
The Holiday Inn Express Times Square is a new hotel with clean rooms, free internet, and a business center. It's located close to Penn Station and Times Square.

The Holiday Inn Express Chelsea is a good option for business travelers due to its convenient location near Penn Station and the subway, free high-speed internet, a business center with computers and printers, and a decent complimentary breakfast. Some rooms have a desk, and the hotel offers free local calls.

The Holiday Inn is a good option for business travelers, with wireless internet access and a location convenient to downtown and multiple subway lines. It also offers a business center, car service, and is within walking distance to Wall Street and the financial district.
The Holiday Inn Midtown offers free in-room WiFi, a basement gym, and is near public transportation. The property has meeting areas and a business center that costs $1 per 4 minutes of use.
This Holiday Inn offers free internet (both wired and wireless), a business center, and a desk in each room. The hotel is conveniently located near Penn Station and subway lines.

Hotel 17 is not a good fit for business travelers, as it is a budget hotel with small rooms and shared bathrooms. It's better suited for budget travelers, students, or tourists looking for a clean, quiet, and centrally-located place to stay.

Hotel 31 offers a budget-friendly option in midtown Manhattan, close to the subway, Grand Central Station, and the Empire State Building. Some rooms include a desk, and there is no CNBC available on the televisions.

Hotel 373 is a clean and modern hotel with free Wi-Fi, a desk and chair in every room, and is located close to Penn Station and the subway. There is no lobby, but there is a Starbucks attached to the hotel, and the staff can print boarding passes.

Hotel 41 is a small, clean, and modern hotel in an excellent location near Times Square and subways, with free wi-fi, a desk in the superior rooms, and a popular bar. Rooms can be small, but include amenities like a plasma TV, ironing board, and free reliable wi-fi.

Hotel 99 offers rooms equipped with a writing desk, flat screen TV, and free internet access. The hotel is located on the Upper West Side near a subway station, providing easy access to other parts of the city.
The hotel offers wireless internet for a daily fee and a business center with free computer access and printing. Rooms include a desk and ergonomic chair.

Hotel Chandler is praised for its central midtown location, proximity to subway lines, free Wi-Fi, comfortable beds, and a gym. Some rooms include a work desk and easily accessible electrical outlets.

Hotel Deauville is a budget-friendly hotel with a central location, close to subway lines and Grand Central Station, with free and fast WiFi available. Some rooms have kitchenettes and views of the Empire State Building.

The hotel offers free WiFi, a basement area with computers for guest use, and is located near subway lines for easy access to different parts of the city. Some rooms have a built-in desk and the hotel has a rooftop lounge.
Hotel Elysee is in an excellent midtown location and provides free WiFi. The hotel has a business center and board room.
Rooms include a workspace, CD player, free wireless internet, and easy access to public transportation. The hotel also offers meeting rooms and a business center.

Hotel Giraffe offers comfortable and well-appointed rooms with amenities like free WiFi, a business center, and complimentary breakfast, making it suitable for business travelers. The hotel's location is convenient for access to various parts of Manhattan, with easy access to subway lines and cabs.

The Hotel Grand Union offers a desk but it is small, has no light, and no electrical source to plug in a computer, and there is no WiFi or wired internet in the rooms, but it is available for a fee in the lobby. It may be good for a short stay and is located near Penn Station.

Hotel Indigo offers spacious rooms for NYC, comfortable beds, a desk with an ergo-looking chair, and free hi-speed internet; it is close to the Javits Center, Times Square, Herald Square, and three subway lines. Some rooms lack a luggage rack and coffee maker, and the front desk service may be inattentive.

Hotel Mela has free wifi and desk space making it convenient for business travelers, and an executive room is available. The hotel is near Times Square, and the fitness center includes treadmills, mats, free weights, and a TV.
This hotel offers free internet and printing, a gym, and is centrally located near Penn Station. The Metro Grill provides a convenient dining option.

Hotel Newton is near the subway, allowing for quick transport to Times Square and Penn Station and offers amenities like Wi-Fi, safety deposit boxes, and luggage lockers. Some rooms include a microwave and refrigerator, useful for business travelers.

This hotel lacks desks or workspaces in the rooms, and the gym is small, dark, and has minimal equipment. There is free Wi-Fi, but the hotel is not conveniently located to traditional New York attractions.

Hotel Reserve is located in the Financial District, close to Wall Street and subway stations, making it convenient for business travelers. It offers free Wi-Fi, a business center, and rooms with a desk and flat-screen TV, but the business center has limited hours.
The St. James Hotel is located a block from Times Square with free wifi, and offers a printer.
The Hotel Stanford is conveniently located near Penn Station and offers amenities such as free internet in the business center. Some rooms include a desk and chair.

The Hotel Wales offers wireless internet access for a daily fee and some rooms have a separate sitting area suitable for work. The hotel also provides a business center and is located near public transportation.

The Hudson Hotel has a small desk in some rooms, but no comfortable chair, and several reviewers mention the lack of space for laptops, while other reviewers mention there is a business center. The location is close to subway lines.

Ink48 offers amenities like free Wi-Fi, a business center (though still being set up during the review period), and is a short walk or cab ride to business areas, with staff offering helpful recommendations. Some reviewers noted convenient access to the Javits Convention Center and plentiful taxis.
I am sorry, but there isn't enough information in the reviews to determine if this hotel is a good fit for business travelers. The reviews focus on amenities for couples, families, and tourists.

The Barclay InterContinental is conveniently located in midtown Manhattan near Grand Central Station, making it accessible to many corporate offices. Rooms include spacious desks, and the hotel provides business center and room service.

This hotel offers comfortable work spaces, good beds and bedding, and the ability to plug an iPod into the TV speakers. There is also a gym, and the Wall Street Journal and New York Times are available.

The Kitano is near Grand Central Station with easy access to subway lines, and offers comfortable beds, a good workspace, and upgraded sewing kits. The hotel provides quiet, clean rooms, and efficient service, appealing to business travelers seeking a peaceful environment.
La Quinta Manhattan offers free WiFi, wired internet, and a business center, but the WiFi signal can be weak in some rooms. Some rooms have a desk and phone in the bathroom.

Lafayette House offers free Wi-Fi and suite-sized rooms, some with a sitting area, fireplace, and kitchenette; the hotel is located near several restaurants, but lacks room service and has limited office hours. Some rooms have a terrace and courtyard access.
Le Parker Meridien is well-located for business, with a large desk area in rooms and internet access for a fee. The hotel also offers meeting spaces and a business center.

The Library Hotel offers free WiFi, a business center, and a location near Grand Central Terminal, with access to six subway lines. Some reviewers found it convenient for business trips, while others cited IT infrastructure problems.

The Loews Regency is noted as a top-notch business hotel with an excellent location near midtown and the Upper East Side. It features a superior fitness center often used by locals, and some rooms include a workspace and comfortable desk.

The Lowell offers amenities such as a gym, free computer and printer usage, and in-room kitchenettes. The hotel is located on the Upper East Side, near shopping on Madison Avenue and close to the F and 6 subway lines.

Located in the Time Warner building with access to shops, it has a business center open all night and rooms with a desk and ample outlets. The hotel has meeting rooms, multi-line phones, and internet on the flat-screen TV.

The Milford Plaza has wired internet access, but no desk in the rooms, making it difficult to complete work. The hotel is located near Times Square and the A-C-E subway station, providing convenient access to midtown.

The Millenium Hilton is a modern, sleek hotel located in the Financial District, with spacious rooms, large flat-screen TVs, and is conveniently located near multiple subway lines. It offers a business center, though internet access is available at an additional cost.

The Millennium Broadway is conveniently located and offers amenities such as in-room safes, a business center, and internet access, though for an additional fee. Some rooms are equipped with work desks and power strips.

The Millennium UN Plaza offers large rooms with comfortable beds, multiple desks, and useful location for access to the highway and airports. It is located near the UN, making it useful for business, and has workout facilities, though the fitness center is small.
The Moderne Hotel has a library and internet cafe and is located close to subway stops. Some rooms have a desk and strong wifi.

Morgans Hotel offers a business center, and a living room with Apple computers and free tea/coffee; it's located near Grand Central Station. Some rooms have a desk/dressing table area with electrical sockets, and the hotel provides gym access.
The rooms have no in-room internet access, though the lobby has free WiFi; there is also no room service. Some rooms have a desk and chair; Kinko's is nearby for paid internet access.

This hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, close to the subway and major attractions like the Empire State Building and Grand Central Station. It offers clean, basic rooms at an affordable price, but lacks an elevator and in-room amenities like a safe box and hair dryer, with wireless internet access available for a fee.

This Marriott is in a great location for business travelers given it is located in the Financial District and near Wall Street. The hotel has better than average rooms, flat screen TVs, and a gym; Starbucks is also located in the building.

The Marriott East Side is a good option for business travelers due to its proximity to meetings and Grand Central Station, though internet access is an additional charge; rooms include a work desk and comfortable chair. The hotel also has meeting facilities and a business center, although some found the rooms to be small for the price.

The Marriott Marquis is centrally located in Times Square and has helpful staff and a business center, and offers meeting rooms. It has wired internet for $16.95 a night, but some reviewers found the service slow and unreliable.

The New York Palace has big, clean rooms, comfortable beds, and a great gym with complimentary kit, and it's conveniently located for midtown business. The hotel has amenities for business travelers, such as internet access, and is convenient to transportation.

The Night Hotel has small rooms and a tiny desk, but also inexpensive wireless internet (for a fee) and is close to a gym. The hotel's location is convenient for midtown meetings and has a Starbucks nearby for quick access.
This hotel has a business center with free internet access and a printer, and there are multiple reports of the staff being helpful and polite. Some guests stayed here on business trips.

I am sorry, but the reviews do not mention any business-specific amenities. The hotel is described as having suites with kitchenettes, friendly staff, and a location near several neighborhoods and subway lines.

The Omni Berkshire Place is located in midtown Manhattan, providing excellent access to the business district and is near Park Avenue offices. Select Guest members have access to a business office equipped with a conference room, desk, chair, fax, and a computer with free internet access.

The hotel offers well-equipped rooms with comfortable beds and workspaces, but internet access is an extra charge. Some reviewers note that business travelers may find the indifferent staff and lack of local TV channels a drawback.
The hotel rooms are small and offer amenities such as free WiFi, a desk, and an iron with an ironing board. The hotel is located in the Upper West Side, close to the subway.

Points of Concern include no desk in the room and poor design for business travelers, but points of interest include in-room Ethernet (but fee-based) and a good location very close to Carnegie Hall. There is also a business center available for printing and faxing.

The Park South Hotel offers free wired internet, a business center with computers and printers, and is conveniently located near a subway line, making it accessible to various parts of Manhattan. Some reviewers noted the rooms are small, but clean, and include amenities like a desk and comfortable bedding.
The Peninsula New York offers bedside control panels, free WiFi, and a business center. Some rooms have desks and easily accessible electrical outlets.
The Phillips Club offers suites with kitchens and is located near Lincoln Center and public transportation. It has conference facilities and caters to business travelers.
The Plaza Athenee is located on the Upper East Side, near shopping on Madison Avenue and Central Park. Some rooms have desks, and the hotel offers concierge service and meeting facilities.

The Radisson Martinique is located close to Penn Station, making it convenient for travelers. Some rooms have a workspace with a desk, and a business center is available, but the wireless internet service can be unreliable.
The hotel offers free wireless internet, a business center, and free local calls. Some rooms have a desk suitable for working, and the hotel is located in the Murray Hill neighborhood.

The Red Roof Inn Manhattan offers clean rooms with work spaces, free internet, and is conveniently located near Penn Station and various subway lines. It also includes complimentary breakfast and phone service.
The hotel has a business center, in-room coffee service, Aveda products, and iHome. Some found the service and restaurant to be inadequate and inconsistent for business travelers.

The Renaissance Times Square is a modern, clean hotel with good facilities, a gym, and a business center in a central location close to subway stops. It also has work desks and internet access in the rooms, with valet parking available.

This hotel has spacious rooms with countertop space that doubles as a desk area, free internet access, and is conveniently located near Grand Central Terminal. It also has a lounge on the 3rd floor, which is a great place to have a drink and work.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park is a good business hotel with spacious rooms, large bathrooms, and comfortable beds, situated in a quiet downtown location convenient to the financial district and offering pleasant staff. The hotel has quality furnishings, excellent cleanliness, town car service, and a nice fitness center, but some found it lacking a "wow" factor and personal touches.

The Rockefeller Center Hotel offers free internet access, a business center, and rooms with office space, making it suitable for business travelers. Some rooms include a desk, microwave, and mini-fridge.
The Roger Smith Hotel is conveniently located near Grand Central Terminal, making it easily accessible, offers free Wi-Fi, provides comfortable rooms, and has a restaurant and bar on-site

The Roger Williams Hotel is often used by business travelers because it is clean, centrally located, and offers free internet access. It has a gym and comfortable rooms that are conducive for working.
Room Mate Grace is near Times Square, offers free Wi-Fi, and has spotty internet connection. The hotel also has small rooms and limited space to work.
The Royalton Hotel is conveniently located in midtown Manhattan, close to transportation hubs, and has a business center. Some rooms include a desk and wifi access is available for a fee.
The Salisbury Hotel is recommended for business travelers due to its good-sized rooms, a comfortable business chair, and a desk. Rooms also include a microwave and refrigerator.

The San Carlos Hotel has spacious rooms, a gym with cardio equipment, and a business lounge with free computers and internet access. Rooms include a microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, and free high-speed broadband.
Seafarers International House is located near Union Square, close to the subway, and offers free internet access, and printer. Some rooms have a desk, and the hotel provides a fax service.

This hotel is conveniently located for meetings in midtown and offers quick room service, a gym, and internet access in the rooms and lobby. It has a large lobby and is often busy, so it may not be ideal for business travelers seeking a quiet environment.
The Skyline Hotel offers a business center, concierge service, and is within walking distance of Times Square and many restaurants. Rooms feature a desk and chair.

The Smyth Tribeca offers amenities such as a writing desk, iPod docking station, and a fitness room, but it charges extra for Wi-Fi. Some reviewers noted that the hotel's business center was delayed in opening.

The Sofitel New York is frequently mentioned as a great place for business travelers, due to its convenient midtown location, easy check-in/check-out, free computer services in the lobby, and good exercise room. Rooms include a desk and are generally quiet, allowing for a relaxing stay.
Soho Grand Hotel has a business center and wireless internet, but the internet can be slow. Some rooms have comfortable beds and city views.

Soho House offers free internet service and is located in the Meatpacking District, which is convenient to shops, restaurants, and transportation. Some reviewers mentioned using the hotel for business trips and private parties, and some rooms include sound systems.

The hotel has a business center with free internet and a digital touchscreen phone system that allows you to set your own wakeup calls. There are limited staff and some past guests thought the service unprofessional and the internet did not work properly in the rooms.

The Alex Hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station, has kitchenettes in some rooms, and offers a business center with free internet and printers. There is no wireless internet in the rooms, and desk space may be limited depending on the room.

The Belvedere Hotel offers wireless internet access for a fee, but reviewers note that the connection can be unreliable. Some rooms have a desk, and there is a business center, but the chair in some rooms does not fit in front of the desk.

The Benjamin is located in midtown Manhattan and offers business amenities such as a fax machine, flat screen LCD screen, and wired and wireless internet. The rooms include a work station/desk, and are located close to major office buildings and transportation.

The Blakely Hotel offers a convenient midtown location near transportation, a lobby computer with free internet and printer, and in-room amenities such as kitchenettes, microwaves, and coffee makers. Some rooms have a separate sitting area which can be useful when traveling with others.
The hotel offers free wifi, laptop rentals, and high-speed internet access. There are desks in each room and generally quiet rooms available.

The hotel offers rooms with hardwood floors, a cordless phone on the desk, and easy access to locations all over the city. Some rooms have iPod docking stations, and some suites can be rented out for events.

Carlton Hotel is praised for its clean, spacious rooms equipped with wireless internet, a safe, and a comfortable bed, with in-room dining available. It is centrally located in Midtown, close to public transportation and major attractions, but some found the service lacking.

The Carlyle offers prompt service and a quiet atmosphere, with staff described as career hotel professionals. Some rooms have desks and well-lit seating areas, and the hotel is capable of handling various requests.

The Franklin Hotel offers free wireless internet, a complimentary computer in the lobby, and is located on the Upper East Side, near the subway for convenient access to other parts of the city. Some rooms have a desk and newspaper delivery is offered.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments offer a convenient location near Times Square and subway lines, free WiFi, and rooms with kitchenettes, which may be suitable for business travelers. Some reviewers noted the availability of local event newsletters and proximity to various restaurants.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea offers free Wi-Fi and a business center with computer access, but some reviewers mention rooms are very small and may not be ideal for business travelers needing space to work or store luggage. One review notes a $1 a day "charity" charge was added to the bill, which may cause issues for business travelers submitting receipts.
The Gem Hotel offers free wireless internet, a desk, and climate control. There is no room service or gym, but coffee-making facilities are available.

The Gem Hotel Soho offers free Wi-Fi, a desk in each room, and is conveniently located near subway lines and various restaurants. Some reviewers noted the rooms are small, but clean and well-maintained, with amenities like a mini-fridge and microwave available.
I am sorry, but there is not enough information in the reviews to recommend this hotel for business travelers.
This Hampton Inn offers free wired and wireless internet in the rooms and free coffee in the lobby, as well as a work desk and ergonomic chair. It is near the subway and Port Authority bus station.
The hotel has spacious rooms, with some rooms including kitchenettes, sitting areas, and balconies. It is located close to subways and Central Park.
The hotel has responsive reception staff, desks and chairs that are not conducive to working for long periods, and a business center. Some rooms have no convenient outlet for plugging in a computer.

The Herald Square Hotel is centrally located near transportation hubs like Penn Station and subway lines. It offers amenities such as free Wi-Fi, work desks, and guest laundry facilities, but has small rooms with limited services, and can be noisy due to construction.
Hotel 91 offers free wired internet (DSL or ethernet) and a small desk in the rooms. There is no wireless internet, and the desk space may be too small for extensive work.

The Hotel at Times Square offers a business center, free Wi-Fi, and a convenient location near Grand Central Station, making it a practical choice for business travelers. Rooms include a desk, comfortable beds, and in-room coffee makers.

This hotel may not be suitable for business travelers as some reviews mention noise issues and the lack of a desk in some rooms. The hotel is described as a getaway within NYC, and the staff is noted to be flakey on faxes and wake-up calls.

The Iroquois is located in midtown Manhattan and has a library with computers, free Wi-Fi, and rooms with work desks. The hotel also offers fax services, meeting spaces, and shuttle services to airports.

The Jane Hotel offers small, cabin-style rooms with amenities like high-speed internet, a flatscreen TV, and a dedicated workspace. It is located near subway stations and provides a safe, quiet neighborhood, suitable for travelers who primarily need a place to sleep and work.

The Kimberly Hotel offers suites with amenities such as a desk with a fax machine, printer, copier, high-speed internet access, and a laptop-sized safe. It also has a new board room, and the staff is known for their efficiency.
The Lombardy is a small boutique hotel with large rooms, some with kitchens, located on 56th St between Park and Lex. It is near restaurants, delis, bars, drug stores, and a subway station.

The London NYC is well-suited for business travelers with rooms equipped for comfort and technical needs, spacious suites, a good gym, and close proximity to local attractions. Some reviewers note that the hotel offers a complimentary car service within a 20-block radius, catering to business needs.
The Lucerne offers a desk in some rooms and free wifi. Some reviewers mention interet access only available through the business centre for a fee.
The Manhattan Club has a business center on the 26th floor with computers and printers available for guests. Wireless internet is free in the suites.

The Mansfield Hotel is in Midtown, near Times Square and Grand Central, which allows for subway access to multiple locations, and offers free Wi-Fi, a business center, and a gym. Some rooms are small, dark, and noisy, and some have heating and AC issues.

The Marcel Hotel is not great for business trips because the internet was often not working, but they still charged for it and the movie selection did not work and they still tried to charge for it. There are no hotel amenities and the rooms are smaller than usual.

The Maritime Hotel is conveniently located near subway stations, Chelsea Market, and the Meatpacking District. It offers free WiFi, a business center with free printing, and efficient room service, but rooms are small.
The Mark is located on the Upper East Side, close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping. Some rooms include kitchenettes, and wireless internet access is available.

The Marmara Manhattan offers apartment-style rooms with full kitchens, free WiFi, and amenities like a fax/printer/copier. Some suites include a dining area and workspace, and the hotel provides free newspapers and laundry tokens.
The MAve Hotel is in a central location convenient for business, with subway access and walking distance to Times Square. It offers modern decor, helpful staff, and free WiFi.

The Mercer is located in SoHo near subway connections, and offers amenities such as free Wi-Fi, a business center, and room service. Some rooms include iPod docks, stereos, and large TVs, and guests have access to a nearby Equinox gym.

The Michelangelo Hotel offers a convenient midtown location for business trips, proximity to corporate towers, and a complimentary limo service to the financial district during the week. Some reviewers noted smaller rooms, worn furnishings, and noise from the air conditioning system.

I am sorry, but the provided reviews lack specific details catering to business travelers. The reviews mention free wifi and no business center; however, they also focus more on the hotel's value, location, and suitability for families or tourists rather than the specific needs of business travelers.

The Muse Hotel is a smaller, boutique-type hotel with creative yet comfy decor, rooms with work spaces, and free internet access for Kimpton InTouch members. It is centrally located near Times Square and subways, but some rooms can be noisy.

The New York Helmsley is conveniently located near Grand Central Station, making it accessible to transportation, and offers free WiFi. Some rooms have a desk and the hotel has a business center, though some reviews mention it may have limited availability or incur a fee.

The New Yorker Hotel is conveniently located near Penn Station and major subway lines, with a business center, free WiFi, and rooms that include a work desk. Some rooms are small, and there is no bar or room service available.

The Pierre hotel offers amenities such as desks with free internet, printers, fax, and copiers for business needs, and is located close to transportation. Some rooms have a separate seating area suitable for conducting business.
The hotel has a conference center, offers modern amenities such as large flat screen TVs, and provides laptop ports in the rooms. Broadband internet access is available.

The Pod Hotel is noted for its convenient location in midtown Manhattan and the availability of free WiFi, making it suitable for business travelers. The rooms have a desk and the hotel offers a business travel desk, but the small rooms and thin walls may not be ideal.

The Premier is a boutique hotel connected to the Millennium Broadway, offering amenities like free cable internet, a large desk area, and breakfast. Rooms have a sofa, flat-screen TV, and are well-isolated from outside noise.
The Ritz Carlton Central Park is conveniently located near transportation and business districts. It offers meeting rooms, business services, and club-level access with concierge services.

This hotel is conveniently located in midtown near many banking and finance companies, and a car service is available to take you to the airport. Internet access is available in the rooms for a fee, and there is a business center available.

The Sherry-Netherland offers quick check-in/check-out, a gym with cardio equipment and weights, and is located conveniently for mid-town meetings with easy access to cabs. Some suites have kitchens and living rooms, and corporate discounts may be available.

The Shoreham Hotel offers free WiFi, a 24-hour espresso machine, and a business center with computers and a printer. Some rooms have a desk area, but they are small, and the hotel is conveniently located for midtown businesses.

The St. Regis is noted as a great place to hold a business meeting with large, classically decorated suites and butler service, including pressing business dress. It also offers high-speed internet, 24-hour services, and a convenient midtown location.
This hotel offers free Wifi, but no business center. The rooms have comfortable beds and a work table, but some reviewers noted the lack of convenient electrical outlets.
The Surrey has ergonomic desks, wireless internet for a fee, and is located near subway options. Some suites have full kitchens and dining tables.
The Sylvan Guest House offers apartment-style accommodations with equipped kitchens, and some units have internet access, while others do not. It is located a 20-minute train ride from Times Square.

The Time Hotel is in an ideal location near Times Square and the Theater District, and offers amenities such as in-room internet, a gym, and a restaurant. Some rooms have a desk, and some suites have a separate sitting room.

The hotel is centrally located with meeting facilities, offers a business center, and has rooms with a desk and high-speed internet access for a fee. Some rooms are spacious and the staff is helpful, but service can be slow, and staff reductions have occurred.

The Westin Times Square is often noted as a business-friendly hotel with amenities including a large desk, and high-speed internet (though for an extra charge), and it is close to transportation options. Some rooms have iMac computers, and there is a business center for printing boarding passes.

Thirty Thirty Hotel offers basic amenities, clean rooms, and a convenient midtown location near Park and Madison Avenues, with hi-speed internet connection on LAN. The hotel also has an attached diner and is within walking distance of many restaurants and food joints.

Thompson LES offers spacious rooms with modern design and comfortable beds and is located near subway lines, making it easy to get to midtown. It also offers amenities such as a large flat-screen TV and a work desk in the room.
This hotel is conveniently located near the Javits Convention Center and offers wireless internet access for a fee. Rooms include microwaves, refrigerators, and irons/ironing boards.
The hotel has a work desk with an Aeron chair, a fax machine, and wireless internet in the rooms, as well as a 24-hour business center. It is conveniently located near multiple subway lines.

The Trump International Hotel offers amenities suitable for business travelers, such as chargers for mobile phones, computers, and fax machines, as well as personalized stationery. Meeting rooms are well-stocked and attended to, with services like immediate pressing of one garment upon arrival.

The Tudor Hotel is near the UN, a short walk to Grand Central, and has amenities like in-room internet access, a business center, and comfortable beds. It's also described as a convenient location for business trips.

The Vincci Avalon offers free internet in the lobby, rooms with a work desk, and is near Penn Station and Grand Central Station. Some reviewers note frustrations with the internet connection being slow or unavailable.

W The Court is in a great midtown location, close to Grand Central Station with many restaurants nearby. The hotel offers good service, large rooms, and amenities like a fax machine, in-room broadband, and free car service in Acura SUVs.

The W Tuscany is conveniently located near Grand Central Station and Midtown, making it accessible for business travelers. Rooms offer workspaces, comfortable beds, and internet access (though not always free), but some rooms can be noisy due to elevator proximity.

The W Times Square is a trendy, modern hotel with free wifi in the lobby, outlets in sensible places, and ample workspace. Some reviewers recommend it for business stays due to its great service and amenities.

The W Union Square offers amenities such as in-room WiFi for a fee, a gym, and a business center, but some found the gym and business center to be small. The hotel's location near Union Square provides convenient access to transportation and nearby businesses.
The hotel offers business facilities, though some reviewers found them overpriced. Some suites include an office area, and the hotel's location is convenient to uptown and downtown.

The Wall Street Inn is located near the financial district and Wall Street subway station, making it accessible to business engagements. It offers free Wi-Fi, a business center, and room service from local restaurants, but some reviewers have noted issues with staff knowledge and service for business travelers.

The Warwick Hotel is noted for its central Midtown location, offering proximity to Central Park, shops, and theaters, and has a gym with newer equipment. The hotel also has business services such as free internet and a business center.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel is a budget-friendly option with comfortable beds, a desk, and free wireless internet; however, the rooms are small, there is no coffee in the room or lobby, and the free wifi can be unreliable. Some rooms have iPod docking stations and work spaces, and free printing is available at the front desk.
Washington Square Hotel is located near NYU and has a subway stop at the corner that links to JFK airport and easy access to taxis. There is also free, quick internet via cable supplied by the hotel.
This hotel is in a convenient central location and has a helpful staff and business center. It offers wireless internet, and some rooms have work desks.
The hotel offers free high-speed internet, a desk area in the rooms, and is located near public transportation. Some rooms have technological enhancements, and there is a business center.

The hotel is well-equipped for business travelers, offering free high-speed internet, comfortable desks and chairs, and a business center. Free US phone calls are available, as mobile phone reception can be unreliable throughout the building.

The Wolcott Hotel is centrally located near the Empire State Building and offers amenities like a business center and in-room safes. Some rooms include multiple TVs, desks, and internet access for a fee.

This apartment-style lodging provides amenities such as kitchenettes, refrigerators, and internet access, but lacks daily maid service. The location is near the subway, but the front desk hours are limited.

Wyndham Garden Hotel is suitable for business travel due to its proximity to Penn Station and the Convention Center, free Wi-Fi, a business center, and well-equipped rooms with workspaces. It also offers amenities such as a gym, and a bar.
